oai_dc:dc.dc:title: CHEMOSTAT STUDIES ON IRON REMOVAL FROM FERRIC CITRATE MEDIUM BY AEROBIC CULTURE OF AEROMONAS SP
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GOPALAN, R
VEERAMANI, H
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: complexes
pure
iron removal
ferric citrate
chemostat
aeromonas sp
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Iron resistant isolate (F16) of Aeromonas sp. capable of removing 68% iron from synthetic ferric citrate medium [Fe(III) - 650 mg l-1] in aerobic batch cultures was used in continuous studies in three parallel 2-1 chemostats operated at 27-29-degrees-C with hydraulic retention time of 36-72 h and feed iron concentration of 100-650 mg l-1 for a period of 100 days. Maximum iron removal efficiency of 99.6% was obtained at 72 h retention time with specific iron removal rate of 9.5 mg g-1 h-1; the efficiency was 20-60% for 36- 48 h retention period.
